analyzer
Class TextFileAnalyzer

java.lang.Object
  analyzer.TextFileAnalyzer

public class TextFileAnalyzer
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides the funcionality to read data like the count of rows, sentences and word as well as
the average length of one word. In addition to that, it allows you to copy the file described by an object
of this class, with a length for each line given by the user of the Testclass. If no length for the lines
is specified, the old line length is inherited.

This Application is reading the files it gets all line by line, so that Bufferoverflows cannot occur.
also it got tested with text files with the size of 200mb and it needs only abput two seconbds to analyze
it´s details and another 3 seconds to copy it without changing of the line length.
If you change the line length it takes a little bit longer depending on the length sou specified,
but with lengths in the range of 30-100 it also only takes a few seconds to copy.

Version:
2012-04-23
Author:
Gabriel Pawlowsky

Constructor Detail

TextFileAnalyzer

public TextFileAnalyzer(java.lang.String fileName)
                 throws java.io.IOException
A constructor that sets the passed file to our main file.
In addition to that it starts the method analyzeFile, which calculates the details about the file.

Parameters:
fileName - name of the file that will become the main file of this object
Throws:
java.io.IOException - is thrown if the file is not found, or the details are not calculatable
Method Detail

getFileInformation

public java.lang.String getFileInformation()
A method that returns a string with all the details about the main file.

Returns:
all the details about the main file as String

analyzeFile

public void analyzeFile()
                 throws java.io.IOException
Calculates all the details about the main file.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - is thrown if of of the details cannot be calculated

copyFile

public java.lang.String copyFile(java.lang.String pathToNewFile,
                                 int lineLength)
                          throws java.io.IOException
Copies the main file into an new file specified by the first parameter.
It also allows the user to set a maximum line length.
If the maximum line length given by the user is zero, the line length is ignored.

Parameters:
pathToNewFile - the path where the file should be copied to
lineLength - the line length requested by the user
Returns:
an output, that the file was copied successfully.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - thrown if one of the files aren´t accessable
